description: Common aquascaping layout presets recognized by Aquaria. Each includes core traits, difficulty, and search-friendly aliases.

layouts.composition: Stone-based minimalist design with one keystone rock and smaller supporting stones.
layouts.plant_focus: Short carpets and low plants; open foreground.
layouts.aesthetic: Balanced, calm terrain that emphasizes negative space and proportion.

layouts.composition: Organic arrangement of wood, stone, and plants inspired by natural landscapes.
layouts.plant_focus: Mixed species for depth and texture; mosses and epiphytes on wood or rock.
layouts.aesthetic: Looks spontaneous but follows rule-of-thirds balance; evokes a scene from nature.

layouts.composition: Central mound or island of hardscape and plants with open water around it.
layouts.plant_focus: Tall plants in the center fading to low borders.
layouts.aesthetic: Peaceful focal composition, easy to maintain; strong beginner success rate.

layouts.composition: Plants and hardscape rise from one corner to the opposite high point, forming a diagonal triangle.
layouts.plant_focus: Short foreground plants graduating to tall stems at the peak.
layouts.aesthetic: Dynamic sense of flow and direction; fits wide or shallow tanks well.

layouts.composition: Two raised sides frame a central open valley; strong depth effect.
layouts.plant_focus: Tall plants and hardscape on the sides, low carpet or path in the center.
layouts.aesthetic: Inviting ‘window’ into the tank; highlights perspective and scale.

layouts.composition: Dense, semi-wild plant growth with minimal trimming and natural driftwood.
layouts.plant_focus: Fast-growing stems and floating plants for nutrient control.
layouts.aesthetic: Lush, organic, and forgiving; prioritizes biodiversity over symmetry.
